definition: to omit/to delete/to leave out/to neglect/to skip over

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: I always jump introduction to read books.
sentences.chinese: 我看書時常常略去緒論。

sentences.english: The second term in the last-written denominator can be dropped.
sentences.chinese: 上式中分母的第二項可以略去。

sentences.english: The friction between the beams is neglected.
sentences.chinese: 諸梁間之摩擦力略去不計。

sentences.english: I've excluded a lot of excess information here to show you two key pieces of information.
sentences.chinese: 我已經略去了很多信息，只展示兩條最重要的信息。

sentences.english: The asterisked questions may be omitted.
sentences.chinese: 帶星號的問題可以略去。

sentences.english: That's an actuality that the Republicans like to ignore.
sentences.chinese: 這正是共和黨想要去輕輕略去的現實。

sentences.english: The asterisked questions may is omitted.
The inertia terms and those relating to conduction in the X direction were also negligible.
sentences.chinese: 慣性項和那些與X方向的導熱有關的項也被略去。

sentences.english: We now omit the prime on the matrix elements .
sentences.chinese: 我們現在把各矩陣元素上的一撇略去。

sentences.english: But the American phrase "grown man " leaves out the preposition and this neologism is now taking hold in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 略去了介詞，這個新詞語如今正在英國紮了根。

definition: to skate around/to skip over/to skimp
to say more than is necessary/to give unnecessary details
length (of a piece of writing)/space occupied on a printed page
marginal notes/annotation/to annotate/to add comments to text
to relate (a story or information)/to tell or talk about/to recount/narration/telling/narrative/account
writing style (formal)/to send an official written communication
